title: Tropical Cyclone Freddy hammers Mozambique for second time
description: Record-breaking Cyclone Freddy made its second landfall in Mozambique Saturday night, pounding the southern African nation with heavy rains and disrupting transport and telecommunications services

title: Jehovah's Witnesses shocked by Hamburg attack, thank police
description: The Jehovah’s Witnesses have expressed shock over the deadly shooting at one of the group’s halls in Hamburg, Germany, but thanked German police for preventing more bloodshed through their swift intervention

title: McCarthy’s California visit with Tsai an attempt to thread Taiwan needle
description: Kevin McCarthy, advised of political implications of a Taipei visit, plans to meet Taiwan’s president in at a Reagan Library event in California.

title: What to know about the U.K.'s controversial new asylum plan
description: The plan, which seeks to dissuade asylum seekers from crossing to Britain by boat, has been panned by critics as illegal and inhumane — and sparked tumult at the BBC.

title: Israelis protest proposed legal changes for 10th week
description: Tens of thousands of Israelis demonstrated Saturday against a contentious plan to overhaul the judiciary as the government pressed ahead with the plan

title: More than 40 vehicles involved in highway pileup in Hungary
description: Police and rescue crews have responded to a pileup on a highway in Hungary

title: Quake death toll nears 48,000 in Turkey, 6,000 in Syria
description: The head of Turkey’s disaster and emergency management agency has raised the country’s death toll from a magnitude 7.8 earthquake last month to 47,975

title: Ukrainian firefighters on risky mission to save lives, homes
description: The firefighters find thick grey smoke pouring from the roof of a brick house that is one of several homes hit by Russian shelling in a residential neighborhood of Kostiantinivka

title: Police say stalker killed podcaster and her husband Friday
description: A man suspected of stalking a podcast host for months was found dead Friday after police believe he killed the podcaster and her husband inside their home in the Seattle suburb of Redmond

title: Landmine blast kills 2, injures 1 in SW Pakistan
description: A Pakistani official says a landmine explosion in the country’s southwest has killed two people and critically injured another

title: Soccer hero’s tweet on asylum kicks up huge culture war and BBC boycott
description: The BBC's decision to suspend its star soccer presenter, Gary Lineker, from its popular "Match of the Day" show has ignited a fierce debate about free speech.

title: Hong Kong court jails three activists behind Tiananmen vigil
description: Three members of the now-disbanded group, which organized annual Tiananmen vigils in Hong Kong, were jailed for four-and-a-half months over a police information request.

title: UK protest backs health staff as doctors prepare to strike
description: Thousands of protesters have marched through London to support health care workers, who have held a series of strikes over pay and conditions in the state-funded National Health Service

title: Italy's coast guard, navy, bring hundreds of migrants ashore
description: Italian coast guard and navy vessels are ferrying hundreds of migrants to shore after rescues in the Mediterranean

title: Tractor-trolley in Pakistan falls into canal, killing 10
description: An official say a tractor-pulled trolley transporting villagers to a shrine fell into an irrigation canal in eastern Pakistan, killing at least 10 people

title: Haunted by post-election riot, Brazil's Lula reins in army
description: When rioters stormed Brazil’s top government buildings in January to dispute the outcome of the presidential election, many soldiers stood by as far-right protesters broke windows, defecated in offices and destroyed valuable art

title: UK: Russian advance in Bakhmut could come with heavy losses
description: U.K. military officials say Russian forces have advanced in the eastern city of Bakhmut, a key target of Moscow’s grinding offensive that has brought staggering casualties, but they risk further harsh losses if they push ahead

title: Yemen sides begin UN-brokered talks on prisoner exchange
description: The U.N. says Yemen’s warring sides have begun talks aimed at implementing a U.N.-brokered deal on a prisoner exchange

title: IS group says it killed more than 35 'Christians' in Congo
description: The Islamic State group has claimed responsibility for killing more than 35 people and wounding dozens in eastern Congo

title: Syria hopes Iran-Saudi agreement will ease regional tension
description: Syria has welcomed the agreement reached between Iran and Saudi Arabia to reestablish diplomatic relations saying it will lead to more stability in the region

title: Indonesia’s Merapi volcano spews hot clouds in new eruption
description: Indonesia’s Mount Merapi has erupted with avalanches of searing gas clouds and lava, forcing authorities to halt tourism and mining activities on the slopes of the country’s most active volcano

title: Japan marks 12 years from tsunami and nuclear disaster
description: Japan has marked the 12th anniversary of the massive earthquake, tsunami and nuclear disaster with a minute of silence as concerns grew ahead of the planned release of the treated radioactive water from the wrecked Fukushima nuclear plant

title: Tractors head to The Hague, defying ban on farms protest
description: Farmers are driving tractors toward The Hague in defiance of a ban on the heavy vehicles imposed ahead of a protest against the Dutch government’s plan to reduce nitrate emissions

title: Bomb kills 1, wounds 5 at press award event in Afghanistan
description: Police in Afghanistan say a bomb has exploded during an award ceremony for journalists in Mazar-e- Sharif city, killing at least one person and wounded five others

title: South Korea proposes a 69-hour workweek, up from an already long 52
description: As some other countries consider lowering workweeks to four days, South Korea is looking in the opposite direction.

title: Pope Francis at 10 years: A reformer's learning curve, plans
description: Pope Francis is celebrating the 10th anniversary of his election Monday, far outpacing the “two or three” years he once envisioned for his papacy

title: Ukraine live briefing: Outages persist after strikes; Kremlin’s forces being worn down in Bakhmut, Kyiv says
description: Ukraine is outperforming its hopes of grinding down elite Russian units in Bakhmut, a senior Zelensky aide told Italy’s La Stampa newspaper.
